newsitem.title: USA: U S West may sell Minn. cable systems - WSJ.
newsitem.headline: U S West may sell Minn. cable systems - WSJ.

text.p: U S West Inc is close to an agreement to sell its cable systems in Minneapolis-St. Paul to closely held Charter Communications for about $600 million, the Wall Street Journal said.
In Friday's electronic edition, the Journal said the systems up for sale were acquired by U S West last year as part of its $10 billion purchase of Continental Cablevision Inc of Boston.
The sale would allow U S West to pay down debt as well as satisfy federal laws that prevent telephone companies from owning cable systems in the same market.

U S West Media Group, the publicly traded cable and wireless unit of U S West, is being forced to sell off the systems because Minnesota is part of the parent company's 14-state telephone market, the Journal said.
Specific terms were not immediately available. However, sources told the Journal the price is about 10.5 times cash flow.
